inn1.comm: predictably, there's a touch of swing for Praveen first up. This one wobbles away through the air outside off and is left alone
curving away once more, and Cook punches hard to cover off the back foot to cover, where Rahane pulls off a diving stop
Cook doesn't quite have the requisite room for the cut, and a cramped shot is bottom-edged straight down
fuller from Praveen, and Cook leans forward into a punchy drive. Cover point gets a hand to it, and the man on the edge of the circle stops the single
full, wide and swinging away. This time Cook's not tempted, and leaves alone
a full length delivery just about on off stump is pushed to extra cover, and Praveen starts with a maiden
banged in just short of a good length outside off, the ball seaming away as it's left alone by Kieswetter
pushed firmly to cover off the back foot, but there's a ring of fielders there to stop the shot
slung down on a length just outside off. The delivery goes straight on after pitching, but is safely left on length
Kieswetter is half forward and defending to extra cover
Kieswetter continues to play with utmost caution, leaving alone outside off
a checked punch bounces into the covers, and there's no run to be had. Two maidens on the trot for India!
Cook swivels back to pull but is beaten on the under edge and struck on the thigh
finally, runs! Nice shot from Cook, who leaned forward to place a drive wide of mid off. Once it beat the fielder it raced quickly to the fence
a flashing drive, and a play-and-miss! Praveen got this one to jag sharply away off the pitch, and a flat-footed Cook didn't get close
this time the feet did move, but it didn't make a difference, and Cook is beaten once again!
beaten for the third time in a row! Well, there's nothing really extravagant off the pitch but Cook is struggling to put bat on ball. This time he is back and cutting, to no avail
straighter from Praveen to finish, and Cook taps it back to the bowler
Kieswetter has had enough of defence! He comes down the track to the first ball, a length delivery, and smashes a towering six back over the bowler's head. That's more like it
and he follows that up with studied defence as Vinay hones in on the top of off
appreciable seam movement away from the batsman, and off a good length too. Kieswetter raises his hands to leave alone
slapped hard through cover point! Vinay offered too much width, and Kieswetter scythed through the line of the ball to send it racing to the boundary

Kieswetter is up and running with another boundary! This was another gift from the bowler, who speared the ball towards leg stump. Fine leg was very wide, and couldn't get around to stop Kieswetter's glance
a full ball on off stump is met with solid defence
good placement brings Cook a couple, his shovel to leg bisecting the men at mid on and midwicket
whipped into the leg side again, but straight at the fielder this time
cut hard, but again Cook hits the field
fetched into the leg side again, but the ball is stopped inside the inner circle
hammered through point! Cook breaks the shackles with a flashing cut
punched firmly to mid off to end the over
nudged watchfully to square leg
drilled down the ground! Kieswetter isn't going to let Ashwin settle, and uses his feet to get to the pitch, slapping the ball with great power
Kieswetter on the charge! Again he's down the track, but this time doesn't bother to keep it down. Quite the opposite, in fact, and a towering six lands in the crowd beyond wide long on.
the carrom ball from Ashwin, but it slips down the leg side and comes off the face of Kieswetter's bat. Four more!
floated down outside off, Kieswetter defends to midwicket and finds something of a gap, allowing a single

he's given him! The ball rushed straight on as Cook pressed forward, rapping him on the front pad. The appeal was exuberant, and Umpire Asnani's finger went up straight away. Cook doesn't look entirely pleased with the decision. He was a long way down the pitch, stretching forward

both openers depart, Kieswetter following his captain and falling lbw. This one shot through very low off a length, nipping under Kieswetter's defensive bat and hitting him right in front. It was obviously plumb, and Praveen's appeal was a little Broad-esque, as he charged towards his team-mates in celebration before belatedly turning to appeal
Pietersen lunges forward to defend his first delivery
punched just wide of mid off, and Pietersen is off the mark with a scampered single
superb touch! That's quite a way to get off the mark. Praveen pitched one up outside off, and Trott leaned into a checked cover drive to caress the ball to the boundary
again Trott is forward and driving, but this time the ball goes to mid off
Praveen keeps his length full, and Trott's drive is intercepted in the covers
a watchful drive is placed into the covers, Jadeja having come round the wicket
pitched right up on off stump, Pietersen eases a single to long off
tapped gently to cover
driven hard towards mid off, and a diving stop cuts it off
Jadeja offers width outside off, but the backfoot punch goes to point
driven to long off for an ambled single to end the over
pitched up and wobbling away from the batsman outside off. Trott comes forward and drives hard to cover
punched down the ground. Mid on scoots round to stop the shot, but a single is taken
Pietersen stands tall and cracks a length delivery hard back to the bowler
there's plenty of intent in this backfoot slap from Pietersen, but the ball goes straight to mid off
lifted over long off! The delivery - a long half-volley - invited the shot. Pietersen seemed to have sliced across it a little, but the timing was good enough for the ball to clear the rope
drilled at mid off to end the over. The man is deep so the single is on
Pietersen bends into a sweep, sending the ball bouncing out to the man at deep square
whipped off the pads to deep midwicket, and they're back for the second
a poor delivery gets the treatment, Trott hanging back to thump a long hop through cover
fuller and straighter from Jadeja, and Trott drives to straight mid off
Trott stays back to defend quietly back to the bowler
cracked into the covers, where the shot is stopped
good pace, nice line, left alone outside off
on the toes, whipped hard but straight to short midwicket.
on the hip, flicked round the corner
full length on off stump, punched back down the ground
outside off, defended out to cover
helped into the leg-side with a turn of the wrists. A decent first over
blocked on the line of middle stump, back down the track
clipped calmly to mid-on
slightly back of a length, driven on the up towards the bowler
worked out to leg again
blocked stoutly back down the wicket
nothing to work with. Tight over
full length on off stump, driven out to cover
a bit more width, steered to deep cover with an open-faced drive
tidy line and length, driven without conviction to mid-off
a rare loose delivery, and that was slapped into the covers, but well intercepted to save a certain four
drop and go into the covers. Tight work from India
defended with a straight blade to midwicket
in the air, but that couldn't be cut off at backward point. A slightly loose cut, but effective
nothing to work with there
driven back to the bowler
excellent probing length
a diving stop in the followthrough to keep England under wraps
compact drive to cover
finds the gap with a flick to midwicket
worked into the covers
low full toss, flicked hard through midwicket. That'll do
worked leg-side again
a open-faced jab down to third man
more excellent work on and around off stump. Driven respectfully again
short and wide, but Pietersen is taken aback and misses out with a wild slash
on the pads, tucked to midwicket
a yelp of anguish from behind the stumps, but for no particular reason
pushed into the covers. Steady stuff
tucked into the gap
better line and length already
speared into the pads of an advancing Pietersen
fuller length, deflected to midwicket
clipped out to midwicket, finds space this time
shovelled to leg. England are under wraps for the moment
a wristy drive into the covers, but no power
Trott returns the strike
good placement, forced into the gap at point and they sprint a good single
good work from Trott, he doesn't get bat on his reverse sweep, but he does enough to deceive Dhoni
a fraction short and too much width. Slapped emphatically through point
short again, but not quite such good placement on this cut shot
clipped uppishly to midwicket
short and straight, the carrom ball potentially. Defended
turned calmly off the pads to midwicket
driven on the up to mid-on
flicked off the hip but without much power
blocked back to the bowler
a slapped drive to mid-on
on the pads, flicked round the corner
a charge from KP, and that flies off a leading edge, and falls short of gully. A bit lucky
misdirected, always heading down leg
a crunching drive, but straight to mid-off
full face, pushed up to mid-on
tip and run to mid-on, excellent early call and Trott is safely home despite a direct hit
pushed down to lon on. Ashwin rushes across to try and stop it but bumps straight into Pietersen
a premeditated sweep pops up but short of fine leg
Pietersen presses forward in cautious defence
tapped through cover for a quick single
worked wiht the spin into the leg side, straight to the man at midwicket
driven down the ground, one more to the total
intelligent strokeplay from Trott! He stepped away to leg and slapped the length ball hard and well in front of square, beating the cover sweeper
this time he comes forward with an angled bat and taps to gully
bowled him! Kumar had been seaming them away, mostly, but this one pitched and jagged in off the wicket, bursting through the gap between bat and pad to rattle the stumps
a probing length delivery on middle and off is nudged defensively to leg
neatly turned off the pads, and Ravi is off the mark. He was keen for a second, but Pietersen sent him back
a drop-and-run single ends the over, Pietersen dead-batting it into the leg side and setting off
Pietersen very nearly loses his footing and swings himself off his feet! He had moved right across to the off side but couldn't connect with an extravagant sweep, tumbling over
just short! Pietersen came down the track and looked to flick the ball into the leg side, popping the ball just in front of the midwicket fielder
punched away for a rather less dramatic single
pushed firmly back to the bowler
turn and bounce for Ashwin! The ball pitched outside off but spun towards leg stump, bouncing up to hit Bopara on the thigh
defended solidly towards extra cover
Vinay Kumar finds shape back in towards Pietersen through the air, and rushes across to stop a firm defensive push in his follow through
shot! This really pinged out of the middle. The ball was short of a length but Pietersen just walked at the bowler and slapped it on the up to deep extra cover
fuller from Vinay, and it's dug out to cover
something of an attempted bouncer from Kumar, but it barely gets up off this benign surface and Pietersen is not hurried as he clobbers a pull out to deep square
beaten on the outside edge! Kumar hits the seam to move one away from the right-hander. Bopara poked at it from the crease and couldn't lay bat on ball
angled cautiously towards point
Ashwin spots Pietersen's shimmy down the track early, pulling his length back and forcing a defensive shot from the batsman
Pietersen is crease-bound this time, and his clip goes straight to midwicket
turned gently to square leg with the spin, the call for a single is immediate
Bopara had set himself for a paddle pull before the ball was delivered, but can only find the single as the placement isn't quite right
the batsman presses forward and defends to cover
again Pietersen looks to use his feet, but the canny Ashwin keeps him quiet with a quicker one
Bopara's on drive finds the fielder at mid on, and there's no single to be had
Kumar is just getting the ball to do a little something off the pitch. Bopara walked down at him but Kumar sent one down wide, seaming it away further to beat his outside edge
beaten once again! There's nothing too dramatic off the wicket, but just enough to keep Bopara guessing. He jabbed at this with an angled bat outside off
fuller and straighter from Kumar, and Bopara flicks to midwicket for one
off the toe end! Kumar sent down a low, dipping full toss outside off that almost slipped underneath Pietersen's bat, but took enough of a bottom edge to beat a diving Dhoni and fly dow to third man
and now Pietersen is beaten! Kumar hits a length outside off, and the batsman plays inside the line as it seams away from him
Bopara telegraphs his intentions to paddle sweep, and is struck on the chest as Ashwin pushes through a quicker one
another paddle to leg, but this time he lays bat on ball for a single to fine leg
speared down without much flight by Ashwin, Pietersen's hurried flick going to midwicket

what a catch! Pietersen bent down low to slog sweep, connecting well and then standing to admire the shot ... only for Manoj Tiwary to come charging across from midwicket before diving full length and clutching the ball with both hands while airborne. But hello, what's this? Pietersen has been stopped at the boundary's edge. Are they checking for the no-ball? It's totally fine, and Pietersen's got to go!
there's more turn and bounce for Ashwin, but his line and length are off, and Bairstow hangs back to get off the mark with a tuck off the hips
punched through extra cover for a single
chipped over cover. Deliberately played by the batsman
floated down outside off. Bairstow has a good look and leaves it alone
a top edged sweep loops off the pad and over the fielders, bouncing down to the fine leg boundary
Bairstow lunges forward to defend back down the track
nice flight from Jadeja, Bairstow stepping back to angle to cover point
and another leave to end the over
he starts with a filthy long hop that is hammered in the air to wide long on, but not hard enough to beat the fielder running round
pitched up outside off but Bairstow stays back to push to cover
shaping gently in through the air towards middle, clipped to midwicket
Kohli offers width outside off, and Bairstow collects a single to deep cover
fetched from outside off, the ball being pushed down to long on for one
and another firm push down the ground brings one more
Bairstow gets well forward to sweep, but toe ends the ball and it goes nowhere
Bairstow waits on the shot to chop down to point, playing with the spin
tapped into space at cover for a single

there goes another one! Speared down at middle stump by Jadeja, Bopara played over the top of it as he tried to sweep and was struck in front of middle and off. The appeal is confident, and Umpire Asnani's finger shoots up. An easy decision, that looked plumb
Samit is off the mark straight away, placing one through cover
a touch of grip off the surface for Jadeja, but it's met with solid defence
hurries through, hastily worked to the leg side
defended more calmly to leg
dabbed down towards third man
helped off the toes, through midwicket
punched down to long-off
uppishly pushed to long-on. Runs at a premium for the moment
finds the gap at cover
sharp spin and edged, but it drops just short
spectacular fielding off his own bowling from Jadeja. A firm drive intercepted
blocked out to point
and that, you have to say, was coming. Bairstow had nowhere to go, feet stuck in the crease, and plays down the wrong line as the ball tweaks past his edge!
punched out to point
a crunching drive to cover
tucked to midwicket
flat and straight, requires a hasty forward defence to escape trouble
blocked into the covers
outside off, nudged out to point
on the pads, flicked out to square leg
outside off and a genuine edge! So genuine that Ravi Shastri immediately shouts "gone!" on comms ... before following up with "for runs ..."
sharp turn, and beaten
lots of bat on that back-cut. Well timed, and placed
huge appeal but that pitched a long way outside leg
on the toes, punched to midwicket
driven back past the diving bowler. Still, a relatively fruitful over for England
tucked square for a single
driven into the covers
chipped into the leg side
stands tall in the crease and drives to midwicket
blocked on the line of middle and leg
slashed out towards deep cover, and that will be drinks
deflected into the leg side
loopy delivery, tweaks into the pads
jabbed through the gully with an open face
tossed up, slapped out to deep midwicket, and Jadeja looks as though he lost it in the sun. A lucky break for England, as it bounces just short
tapped into the gap and they jog through
a tidy over to start the Powerplay
tossed up and clubbed through the gap at midwicket, one bounce and over the rope. Well placed, if not perfectly timed
stands tall and belts the ball back down the wicket
hitting straight again, lobbed over the bowler's head
speared in towards the toes, picked up at mid-on
carved into the covers, well timed but intercepted
short and swished round the corner, but straight to square leg
eased down to long-on
blocked on a good length
swished off the toes
driven out to the covers, picked up with a slide
driven off the back foot to cover
sharp turn to leg, helped round the corner
one more to England's total
good delivery, yorker length, down the leg-side, follows the batsman who has nowhere to go
whoops, that's a horror. Full toss, swinging, way down the leg side
more swing on a leg line. Driven but not timed to mid-off
clumped out to deep midwicket
another filthy delivery from Praveen! That's even wider than the last wide, and it's ten runs from no balls in this over
tip and run into the leg side
on the pads, turned away. That was a good over, apart from the awful balls ...
clunked into the covers
short, but not as short as Bresnan thought, and he plays a cramped pull over midwicket
oh dear, another man perishes on the midwicket boundary ... a slog-sweep, picks out the man, and Ashwin's figures are looking set to be matchwinning ones now
outside off, left alone
good line and turn
a beauty, rips across Borthwick's bows. Quite a spell from Ashwin
good yorker, homing in on leg stump and takes the pad to the off side
top shot...wide half volley and Bresnan drives it powerfully between cover and mid-off
full on middle and worked to midwicket
drives square on the off side and picks out backward point
fired in at middle and leg, worked down the ground to long on
full on middle, squeezed into the midwicket area
round the wicket and driven down to long off
stays round the wicket, worked off leg stump out to deep square
onto the back foot, whipped towards midwicket who can't stop it with a dive and the sweeper tidies up
pushed into the on side and Raina dives in his follow through
outside leg stump and Bresnan takes advantage as he flicks it past short fine-leg...useful innings from Bresnan
pushed out to midwicket
gone! A cracking delivery and Aaron gets his first ODI wicket as he takes out Borthwick's off stump. It may have kept a fraction low but the batsman was caught on the back foot
is greeted by a terrific yorker and Meaker only just manages to keep it out as he jabbed down. The ball then almost spun back towards leg stump
beaten! Pace and swing from Aaron as Meaker has a flat-footed poke outside off stump
this time he tries to pull a delivery from outside off through square leg and doesn't connect
gets bat on ball as he pushes back to the bowler
swings in towards leg stump and takes the pad...an excellent wicket maiden
on off stump and pushed into the off side
dragged down a touch and Bresnan connects well with a pull which beats deep square leg
goes fuller at the stumps and it's driven back to the bowler
this time a drives skews off a thick outside and goes in the air though the covers to the sweeper
touch short again but Meaker doesn't middle his pull and finds midwicket
he gets off the mark with a push down to long on
goes for the leg-stump yorker and spears it past the pads then Dhoni can't collect cleanly
full outside off and late swing beats Bresnan's drive
driven through the covers
this comes out as a full toss on off stump but it's bunted back to the bowler
connects with a pull but it's superbly fielded at midwicket by Kohli who then has a shy at the non-striker's end
down the leg side again, just a little loose in this over but that can happen with a quick bowler
superb! Terrific delivery from Aaron rips out Meaker's leg stump. It had a helping hand from the pads as it swung in late, but the pace is the eye-catching aspect of his performance
another excellent yorker, swings in late to Finn who does well to keep it out
he takes the single with a punch down to long on
full, swinging delivery and it's nudged into the leg side
good length on off stump, defended into the covers
this one is dug out down the ground and midwicket can't cut it off
driven in the air over extra cover, the bat turned in Bresnan's hands so the shot wasn't middled but it landed between fielders
that's well played, a slower ball on off stump and Bresnan opens the face into the off side to ensure he keeps the strike
it's all over! What a beauty to end the innings as this nips past Bresnan's outside edge and clips off stump. There's a slight delay before Aaron notices then he celebrates

inn2.comm: hint of swing first up, it's pushed into the off side and there's excellent understanding between the batsmen
ooh, that was close to a wide as Rahane shoulders arms but he gets away with it
better line, close to off stump and Rahane opts to leave alone which shows good judgement
full outside off, hint of shape away and it's left alone again
pushed wider outside off stump and again he's pushing the margins with the umpire
makes him play to end the over, full on off stump and it's pushed into the covers
on middle and off, defended to the leg side
full on off stump, comes have forward and defends to the off side
good line around off stump, but's well played with soft hands which ensures the ball goes to ground down to third man
pushed towards the pads of the right hander and it deflects down towards fine leg
uses the extra pace of Finn and guides this square through backward point off the back foot
takes an inside edge down to fine leg
onto the front foot and pushed firmly into the covers
whips this off middle stump down to long leg which got Bresnan excited for a moment
pushed across outside off and left alone
ouch! He's taken a blow there as he went for a pull but the ball didn't quite come on and he was struck in the stomach
worked into the leg side towards mid on
lovely shot, pure timing, punched off the back foot through a straight mid-off but it pulls up short of the boundary
goes for a back foot drive and it comes off a thick outside edge down to third man
tight on off stump, solidly defended and Finn skips across to collect
comes forward and drives square into the off side
misses a drive outside off, the ball doesn't carry to Kieswetter who can't collect cleanly but Trott runs back from slip to ensure it's only one run
on off stump, defended into the off side
goes fuller and it's sweetly driven to mid-off
works this away from off stump to midwicket who is fairly square
full and outside off stump, driven straight but without much timing and Pietersen at mid-off tumbles to make the save
pushed down the leg side
behind the line and defends
too straight and it's worked through square with nice timing giving Samit Patel a long chase towards the boundary
first bouncer of the innings and Patel ducks out of the way
has a flash and a miss outside off after being offered some extra width...the ball didn't quite bounce as he expected
that would have been close with a clean piece of fielding...pushed into the off side almost straight to Bairstow at point but he couldn't pick it up
punched nicely off the back foot to cover
gone! Breakthrough. Full length, Patel goes to whip across the line, misses, then his off and middle stumps are pegged back. England rewarded for a tight start with the ball
full on off stump, comes forward and defends square on the off side
defended to the leg side
beaten! Back of a length outside off stump and Gambhir goes fishing
worked away from around middle and off square to forward square leg
punched off the back foot to mid-on
full on off stump, Rahane tries to get forward as he defends to the off side
good stuff from Bresnan, tight on off stump and played into the off side
bouncer over middle and over, Rahane sways his head out of the line and this time it's called wide
back of a length, pushed firmly to mid-on
ooh, nearly another wicket. Full length and Rahane, like Patel, plays across the line and gets a leading edge which falls just in front of the short point
driven behind square down to third man
a full delivery is well driven wide of mid-off but an equally good piece of fielding by Cook prevents a boundary
goes very full, trying to get under Gambhir's bat, and it's well dug out into the off side
another goes! Big wicket, Gambhir plays a flat-footed drive and gets an inside edge into middle stump. Ground goes silent and, for now at least, we have a game on
full on off stump, comes positively onto the front and defends back to the bowler
comes forward and plays a nice drive to cover
plays with an open face outside off and finds backward point
full on middle and off, Rahane plays slightly across his front pad to mid-on
full again at off stump, the ball whistles off the bat straight to mid-off
a fractions short and this time Rahane hangs back then punches to mid-off again
poor delivery on leg stump but he gets away with it as the ball is flicked straight to long leg
tight on off stump and defended back to the bowler
nicely played, guided very late between slip and gully down to third man
outside off and left alone, nice carry through to Kieswetter
full on off stump, a confident stride and drive to mid-off
punched from off stump towards mid-on but the fielder is quite wide so there's a comfortable single
another very full delivery is punched with lovely timing just to right of mid-off
beaten! Nips back at Kohli and keeps a little low to beat the inside edge as the batsman is caught on the crease
good start! Borthwick rips one that keeps quite low outside off, an under-edged cut bursting between Kieswetter's legs and down to the boundary
this wasn't too short but Rahane stayed back, getting low to cut out to deep point
a flighted delivery lands just outside off stump and is driven out to the cover sweeper
a touch quicker and flatter, and Rahane comes forward in defence
nice flight and definite drift from Borthwick, but he's a touch too full and so is driven out to that cover sweeper again
looped up nice and high on off stump, Rahane coming forward to defend to extra cover
pitched right up outside off to start, and Kohli drives straight to extra cover
good length from Meaker, not quite as full as the previous one. Kohli hangs back and turns the ball gently to leg
beaten outside off! Great seam position from Meaker, who found a hint of movement away through the air to beat Kohli
very full again, and Kohli props forward to push to mid on
Kohli goes back and across and defends a length delivery right under the eyes
there's just a hint of inside edge about this shot as Kohli comes forward and aims to push to cover, but the ball squirts into the leg side instead
appreciable turn and bounce for Borthwick, but his length is a little short and he's cracked to cover. Fortunately for him, there's a fielder in the way
not this time though, again Rahane stays back and cuts, this time placing it well enough for a single
Kohli cover drives, beating the man diving across at short extra cover
Rahane skips down the track to take the ball on the full, turning it off his toes and into the leg side for one
shot! Kohli has somehow found a way through the ring of fielders on the off side with a cracking cover drive
a slapped cut is intercepted at point
short of a good length outside off, Rahane stands up and opens the face of the bat to get it down to third man

another superb shot. Kohli is looking unstoppable on the off side. This was a touch too short outside off again, but he just stood up tall and punched through the line with power and balance to collect another boundary
straighter from Meaker, and Kohli clips him to mid on
a drop-and-run single is taken to cover point. Intelligent batting

Meaker strikes! And what a stunning effort behind the stumps by Kieswetter to complete the dismissal. Rahane poked at one that left him off a length, a thick edge flying very quickly to Kieswetter's right. He had to go for the catch as Pietersen was very wide at slip. He pouched it one handed and clung on as he hit the ground. A first international scalp for Meaker, and it's a good one
slanted across the left-hander, who leaves alone. Not the cleanest take from Kieswetter ...
too short, too wide, and Kohli is not in the sort of mood to miss out. Cut hard behind point
much better from the young leggie, and Kohli leans forward in defence
a confident-looking drive can't beat the infield
pushed to cover, they hustle a single ... and there's a direct hit! But he was well in
was this the wrong 'un? Definite variation from Borthwick, but Raina reads it off the pitch and defends
too full, and Raina eases a low full toss down to long on
rising off a length on off stump, Raina hops back to defend
nudged off the pads, just wide of midwicket. The fielder is around quickly and hurls the ball at the stumps, but misses as Raina scoots home
a firm backfoot punch pings the fielder at cover on the edge of the circle
pushed through cover with minimal follow through, and they hurry back for the second
an attempted bouncer from Meaker, but there's not much danger in it and Kohli pulls confidently out to deep midwicket
glanced off the hip and down to fine leg
slashed wide of third man for four! Finn got one to rise off a length outside off but Raina dealt with it in confident fashion, riding the bounce and slapping the ball out of the middle
pace and bounce from Finn keeps Raina deep in his crease as he defends to the leg side
a great shot is met with an equally good stop in the covers. Raina got low on one knee and eased into the shot, timing it really well, but Bopara leapt across at cover to stop it.
Kohli keeps his weight back and works a single through square leg
edged, but in the gap! Both slip and gully were interested, but it wasn't close to either of them
Kohli wants the tip-and-run single to cover, but Raina sends him back with a loud "no!"
Raina pokes his bat out at a rising length delivery outside off, an inside edge ricocheting off his body and allowing a quick single
good length from Meaker, heading for the top of off. Kohli defends into the leg side
the slower one from Meaker, it looked like the offcutter. It's well read by Kohli, who stretches forward into a square drive, but point gets a palm to it to save the boundary
Raina is half forward in defence to another length delivery

chipped up and over mid off! Raina was just getting a bit tied down and looked to break the shackles by clearing the left leg and looking to go over cover. He got a good connection but it kept the man at mid off interested for a while
whipped into the leg side, but straight to the fielder
Kohli presses forward to drive, finding mid off
angled off the hip and behind square into the leg side
nudged into the gap between square leg and midwicket, and they scramble a single
Kohli meets a good length delivery with some very solid looking defence

movement off the seam almost does for Kohli! Superb delivery from Finn. It left the batsman off the the pitch, but he played it with soft hands and it dropped well wide of the man at slip. A good effort by Meaker at third man saves the boundary
dropped into the covers, and the fielder is in quickly enough to stop any thoughts of a single
good start, Bresnan landing one on a length on middle and off to draw Raina's defence
punched firmly to cover point off the back foot
Raina might've been in trouble if this had kept a little low. He shuffled right across his stumps and whipped across his pads, but put bat to ball to get it down to fine leg
fetched across from the off side and placed into the gap at midwicket, an easy single taken
dug in very short by Bresnan, who was aiming for the bouncer. The ball looped high over Raina and was called wide
a direct hit would've had him! Raina cracked one straight at Samit Patel at cover but they set off anyway. Samit threw but missed
defended solidly to extra cover to end the bowling powerplay
full outside off, pushed down the on side and Patel dives over it
full outside off, driven firmly through the covers to the sweeper
punched off the back foot and this time Patel fields cleanly
takes a big stride forward then works this from outside off into square leg...that's what the India batsmen are so good at
too short and it's driven sweetly off the back foot to the cover sweeper
guided square into the off side and they milked that over comfortably
on leg stump, Raina tries to flick it through the leg side but misses and is taken on the pad
outside leg stump and it's clipped down to long leg
onto the front foot, pushed into the leg side
top shot, Raina at his best as he drives on the up through the off side and there's no sweeper out
back-to-back boundaries, poor line from Bresnan down the leg side, Raina moves inside the ball then flicks it off his hip to beat fine leg
half an appeal from Bresnan as a full delivery takes Raina on the pads but it pitched well outside leg stump
nice start, tossed up on off stump and it's pushed to the on side
dragged down short and Raina pulls out to deep square leg
tossed up on off stump, Kohli takes the invitation to drive and finds long off
onto the back foot and tucked to short fine leg
quicker ball, skids on a touch and although it's short Kohli doesn't time his pull
nicely done by Raina, plays with the spin and tucks it fine past the keeper
nearly! Almost the breakthrough as Kohli drives a full delivery and it falls just in front of Kevin Pietersen at cover
beaten, good stuff from Meaker as this shapes away a touch and Kohli pushes at it
fired in at the pads, glances fine and Kieswetter manages to get a glove on it diving to his left before slip runs back to complete the fielding
almost driven in the air again and short cover is in action
uses his wrists and flicks this from around off stump out to deep square
that looks like a drop by Kieswetter, glanced fine down the leg side and he couldn't gather it with his right glove. Wasn't easy, but England need to take them
worked down to long on
sweeps this hard from leg stump out to deep square
driven easily out to deep cover
beaten! Tossed a little wider outside off and Raina tried to glide it through third man
very full and worked off the toes to deep square
googly and Kohli picked it as he played with the spin with a straight bat to deep midwicket
full on off stump and pushed to midwicket
defended into the off side
cracking shot. Too much width and too short from Meaker, gave Kohli time to drive it square off the back foot
nearly a mix-up as this is dropped towards backward point and Kohli wanted a run but was sent back
taken from outside off stump into midwicket
big appeal for lbw by Meaker, it was very full around leg stump but doesn't appear as though it struck him in line
tucked off the stumps into the leg side
nicely bowled, draw him onto the front foot and it turned a fraction
dragged down short outside leg stump and it's easily put away with a pull through midwicket...the hazard of being a young legspinner
big full toss but he gets away it as Kohli clubs straight to mid-on
wide outside off, cut away out to deep cover and they decided not to chance a second which was wise although Kohli made it half way back
uses his feet then defends into the off side
worked away from outside off stump through midwicket. This pair have rotated the strike expertly
a short ball outside off balloons off the surface and bounces awkwardly to Kieswetter
goes across the crease and tucks this into the leg side
good length outside off, defended with a solid clunk back to the bowler
slower ball which is dragged down short and pulled down to long leg
has plenty of time to play this off the back foot, fetches it from outside off through square leg
turned from off stump into the leg side
tossed up and driven easily down to long off
tries to use his feet but the ball is too full and it's jabbed back to the bowler
ooh, close for Borthwick! Raina goes over the top and it doesn't come out of the middle but has enough to clear mid-on
works this off the back foot to deep square leg

missed chance, that was almost Borthwick's first wicket again. Tossed up outside off, Kohli went for a big drive and edged it between the keeper and slip, although replays suggest there was no bat involved. It stuck Kieswetter's gloves and clipped Cook's left hand. Takes Kohli to his fifty and he has grin on his face
on off stump and pushes back to the bowler
half an appeal but it takes him high on the pads
beaten outside off as he tries to glide down to third man
now Raina reaches fifty with a push to mid-off
lovely drive through the covers, he just leant on the shot and sends it wide of the sweeper
defended out to backward point
nicely played by Raina, chopping a late cut to short third man
floated down very full outside off, and Kohli squeezes a square drive to point
Kohli clears his left leg out of the way and slaps the ball hard out to deep cover

Raina comes down the track and slices a drive towards long off ... There were cries of catch it, but he's cleared the mid off fielder with ease, and the four takes the partnership between these two past 100
well-read by Raina. He stepped forward and raised his arms high to leave the wrong-un outside off. He must've read it, if that had been the legspinner it would have hit the stumps
four more! Raina skips down to get to the pitch and smears the ball to wide long on
a punchy drive is hit hard at mid off, who is quite deep and so there's a single on offer
Raina heaves to leg ... or tries to, rather, as he slices under the ball and miscues it over the off-side field
Raina is looking to finish this in a hurry! This wasn't all that short but he was back and pulling in a flash
and another! Dispatched. Raina walked down at the bowler and picked him up over wide long on with a dismissive short-arm jab
a wide is fired down the leg side, and Kieswetter can't stop it cleanly
eased down the ground for a single
a bottom-edged cut slip between Kieswetter's leg and down to third man, and they hurry back for the second
Raina's not going to slow down! He slaps the very first delivery up and over wide long off, having cleared the left leg. He wants that hundred
heaved slightly wildly into the leg side, and they scurry back for the second
clubbed through the covers! Raina stands at the crease and scythes a drive through the off side field. Plenty of words from both sides of the wicket being directed at Raina. I wonder if that'll help?
bowled him! Raina continued to slog at everything and has now paid the price. He swings right across a straight one and is given quite a send-off from Finn
guided down through backward point for a single, Dhoni off the mark straight away

sublime! Kohli doesn't need to slog to hit boundaries. He leans over this and turns his wrists through the line to send the ball racing to the midwicket boundary. Finn is silenced as he trudges away, the chatter now coming from the batsman
Dhoni walks down at Bresnan and chops to point, who has a shy
a direct hit! Dhoni tapped to cover and set off immediately, but the throw was fired in in a flash. Kohli is quick between the wickets, however, and is safely home
Kohli presses half forward to defend to extra cover
super leaping stop by Bairstow at point! Kohli had driven the ball square, on the up, but it was well stopped
angled down to third man for one
Dhoni is squared up a touch as he sets himself to flick into the leg side, and ends up pushing the ball back down the track
the ball hits the seam, taking a thick inside edge and rolling behind square. Dhoni calls Kohli through for one
nudged just wide of the midwicket fielder, another quick single taken
punched firmly off the back foot, but straight to the cover point fielder
nicely worked just to the right of mid on, and there's room for a run
slapped to cover with a hop and plenty of bottom hand. Straight to the fielder
Dhoni slashes at a rising delivery outside off, and is beaten
pushed gently into the covers. Kohli doesn't appear to be in much of a rush
tapped towards mid on this time, the fielder is in quickly enough to stop the single
driven hard to mid off. The fielder was quite deep, but he hit it pretty well so there was no time for a single
tapped to point this time. There's a ring of fielders round him, and he's finding it hard to break through
Bresnan finds some purchase off the wicket, cutting one in sharply to strike Kohli on the thigh
clipped just wide of mid on, and now the single comes
great shot. Placed through cover, the drive being played on the up. He placed it right between the two fielders, and the timing was good enough to take it to the rope
Finn digs one in short, and Kohli rocks back to pull hard out to deep square leg, where there is a fielder in position
and now it's the yorker from the lanky fast bowler, Dhoni digging it out back down the pitch
Finn's trying all sorts now. This was a slower ball, outside off. Dhoni waited on it and chopped down at the ball to send it to third man
ball strikes hip and rolls down to fine leg
driven back to the bowler, who palms the ball to mid off
he keeps to a the full length he was using earlier, and Kohli comes forward to drive to cover
too short, too wide and Kohli slams a backfoot drive through cover point. Top shot
worked off the pads to deep midwicket, and there's India's 200
and here's the Dhoni version of that shot. Again Meaker is too short and too wide outside off, this time the drive is hacked with plenty of bottom hand, but timed just as well
Meaker pitches it up, Dhoni driving into the covers
Meaker ends the over with a good delivery on a length outside off that beats the outside edge of Dhoni's bat
clipped to mid on for a sprinted single ... but the bowler's over-stepped, so there's a free hit coming up
the slower ball is clubbed over long off! Dhoni spotted it early, checked his shot, and then hammered it in the air and right out of the middle

a quicker one beats Dhoni's pull, and strikes him on the thigh. Kohli had set off for the run and was sent back ... interestingly, it appeared he thought about changing direction to block the stumps from Bresnan's view as he picked up and set himself to have a shy, but decided not to, obviously mindful of the new regulations
short and pulled hard out to deep midwicket
a toe-ended drive bounces tamely to mid off
Kohli wanted the single as he flicked this just wide of mid on, but Dhoni didn't think the risk was worth it and sent him back
angled down to third man for a single, just 7 needed now
sharp yorker from Meaker! Kohli is in a bit of pain, the ball having hit him on the toe
timing, placement, and power. Kohli takes India to the brink with a dreamy cover drive
another superb drive from the right-hander, but this time he's hit it straight to the fielder
tapped just wide of mid on, and this time they will take the quick single
the slower one from Meaker, and it bounces a little more than Dhoni was expecting as he hops back to defend
swung to mid on, the bottom hand coming into the shot
there it is! Kohli seals the win with a bunt down the ground, sparking a roar of approval from the crowd
